name: Acyclovir

indications.text: acyclovir ointment usp , 5 % indicated management initial genital herpes limited non-life-threatening mucocutaneous herpes simplex virus infections immunocompromised patients .

contraindications.text: apply sufficient quantity adequately cover lesions every 3 hours , 6 times per day 7 days . dose size per application vary depending upon total lesion area approximate one-half inch ribbon ointment per 4 square inches surface area . finger cot rubber glove used applying acyclovir ointment 5 % prevent autoinoculation body sites transmission infection persons . therapy initiated early possible following onset signs symptoms .

warningsAndPrecautions: acyclovir ointment usp , 5 % supplied white off-white color ointment . gram acyclovir ointment usp , 5 % contains 50 mg acyclovir , usp polyethylene glycol base . supplied follows : 5-g tubes ndc 62332-248-05 15-g tubes ndc 62332-248-15 30-g tubes ndc 62332-248-30 store 15° 25°c ( 59° 77°f ) . [ usp controlled room temperature ] . store dry place call doctor medical advice side effects . may report side effects fda 1-800-fda-1088 . information call alembic pharmaceuticals limited 1-866-210-9797. manufactured : alembic pharmaceuticals , inc. bedminster , nj 07921 , usa manufactured : alembic pharmaceuticals limited ( derma division ) , karakhadi , vadodara 391450 , india . mfg . license . : g/25/2216 manufactured : encube ethicals pvt . ltd. , madkaim , ponda , goa , india – 403404 mfg . license : 361 revised : 03/2025
adverseReactions: acyclovir ointment 5 % contraindicated patients develop hypersensitivity components formulation .
indications_original: Acyclovir ointment USP, 5% is indicated in the management of initial genital herpes and in limited non-life-threatening mucocutaneous Herpes simplex virus infections in immunocompromised patients.
contraindications_original: Apply sufficient quantity to adequately cover all lesions every 3 hours, 6 times per day for 7 days. The dose size per application will vary depending upon the total lesion area but should approximate a one-half inch ribbon of ointment per 4 square inches of surface area. A finger cot or rubber glove should be used when applying acyclovir ointment 5% to prevent autoinoculation of other body sites and transmission of infection to other persons. Therapy should be initiated as early as possible following onset of signs and symptoms.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Acyclovir Ointment USP, 5% is supplied as a white to off-white color ointment. Each gram of acyclovir ointment USP, 5% contains 50 mg acyclovir, USP in a polyethylene glycol base. 
                  It is supplied as follows: 
                  5-g tubes         NDC 62332-248-05
                  15-g tubes       NDC 62332-248-15
                  30-g tubes       NDC 62332-248-30
                   
                   Store at 15° to 25°C (59° to 77°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Store in a dry place
                  
                  
                      
                  
                  Call your doctor for medical advice about side effects. You may report side effects to FDA at 1-800-FDA-1088.
                  For more information call Alembic Pharmaceuticals Limited at 1-866-210-9797.

                     Alembic Pharmaceuticals, Inc.

                  Mfg. License No: 361

adverseReactions_original: Acyclovir ointment 5% is contraindicated in patients who develop hypersensitivity to the components of the formulation.
